1.question: Under accrual accounting, transactions are recorded only when cash is received or paid.

2.question: The owner of Recipes.org purchased $2,000 of supplies on account. Under the accrual basis of accounting, no entry is made until the $2,000 is paid.

3.question: In cash basis accounting, revenue is recognized when cash is received and expenses are recognized when they are paid.

4.question: Under accrual basis accounting, revenue is recorded only when cash is received.

5.question: Under cash basis accounting, revenue is recorded when it is earned, regardless of when cash is received.

6.question: Under accrual basis accounting, an expense is recorded only when the cash is paid.

7.question: Under cash basis accounting, an expense is recorded only when cash is paid.

8.question: The Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) requires the use of accrual accounting.

9.question: If a company is using the accrual basis accounting method, when should it record its earned revenue?

options.A: When cash is received, even though services may be rendered at a later date
options.B: When services are rendered, even though cash may be received at a later date
options.C: When services are completely rendered and cash is received
options.D: When cash is received, 30 days after the completion of the services

10.question: When does a company account for earned revenue if it follows cash basis accounting?

options.A: When services are rendered, even though cash may be received at a later date
options.B: When cash is received after the service is completely rendered
options.C: When the services are being rendered
options.D: When cash is received, either prior to the services being rendered or at a time after the services are rendered

11.question: Which of the following accounts does cash basis accounting ignore?

options.A: Accrual basis accounting is allowed by Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
options.B: Accrual basis accounting records expenses only when cash has been paid for them.
options.C: Accrual basis accounting records revenue only when cash is received.
options.D: It always results in greater net income than cash basis accounting.

15.question: Which of the following would result in an increase in income under the accrual method of accounting, but would not result in an increase in income under the cash basis accounting?

options.D: Receipt of cash for services that were performed earlier on account

options.C: received cash from the customer before goods or services are delivered.
options.D: delivered a good or service to the customer.

options.A: add expenses incurred during one period from revenues earned during that same period.
options.B: subtract expenses incurred during one period from revenues earned during the previous period.
options.C: add expenses incurred during one period from revenues earned during the previous period.
options.D: subtract expenses incurred during one period from revenues earned during that same period.

options.A: ensuring only revenues received in cash are recorded.
options.D: ensuring expenses are deducted from revenues.

options.A: financial statements can be prepared for specific periods.
options.B: a business's activities can be sliced into small time segments.
options.C: all expenses should be recorded when they are incurred during the period.
options.D: companies should record revenue when it has been earned.

options.A: financial statements can be prepared for specific periods.
options.B: all expenses should be recorded when they are incurred during the period.
options.C: companies should record revenue when it has been earned.
options.D: expenses incurred during a period should be matched against the revenues of the period.

31.question: Which of the following entries would be made because of the matching principle?

32.question: Accrued revenues are the income that has been received but not earned.

33.question: Prepaid insurance is an asset account, and hence it appears on the balance sheet.

34.question: Prepaid rent is an expense account, and hence it appears on the income statement.

35.question: A contra account's normal balance (debit or credit) is the opposite of the normal balance of the related account.

36.question: The sum of all the depreciation expense recorded to date for a depreciable asset is called residual value.

37.question: The depreciation method that allocates an equal amount of depreciation each year is called the straight-line method.

38.question: In the case of a prepaid expense, the adjusting entry required at the end of a period will consist of a debit to the Prepaid Expense account. Assume the prepaid expense was initially recorded as an asset.

39.question: In the case of a prepaid expense, the adjusting entry required at the end of a period will consist of a credit to the Prepaid Expense account. Assume the prepaid expense was initially recorded as an asset.

40.question: In the case of unearned revenue, the cash is received first, and the revenue is earned later.

41.question: In the case of unearned revenue, the adjusting entry at the end of the period includes a debit to Service Revenue. Assume the unearned revenue is initially recorded as a liability.

42.question: In the case of unearned revenue, the adjusting entry at the end of the period includes a credit to Service Revenue. Assume the unearned revenue is initially recorded as a liability.
